definition: kang (a heatable brick bed)/to bake/to dry by the heat of a fire
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
surname Kang/Kang, one of the 28 constellations
to make a bed/to lay bedding
wife, kids and a warm bed (idiom)/the simple and good life
pinyin: lao3 po2 hai2 zi5 re4 kang4 tou5

definition: to be laid up in bed with illness

sentences.english: Parents do as many chores as they can on them.
sentences.chinese: 父母在炕上做盡可能多的家務活。

sentences.english: Families gather on them to watch satellite television and DVDs.
sentences.chinese: 一家人坐在炕上看衛星電視和DVD錄相。

sentences.english: In these houses, there are kangs built of stone or brick.
sentences.chinese: 這些房子裏有石頭或磚壘的炕。

sentences.english: It is also installed with pebble beds.
sentences.chinese: 房屋還安裝了卵石蓄熱炕。

sentences.english: In these houses, there were kangs, built of stone or brick.
sentences.chinese: 這些房子裏有石頭或磚砌的炕。

sentences.english: A large family around on the kang, desk in the middle of the are preparing to eat meal.
sentences.chinese: 一大家人圍着放在炕中間的桌子正準備喫年夜飯。

sentences.english: After two hours, he let her crawl back in bed.
sentences.chinese: 兩個小時以後，他才讓她爬上炕來。

definition: to make a bed/to lay bedding
to light a fire for cooking
central room of a traditional Chinese house
